message: What's with all the new players pulling off/almost pulling off all-kills?
4v4's generally either reduce to mass cheese, really short combined attacks, or a 20 minute game of nothing punctuated by a massive battle.  I much prefer the current 1v1 team format.
For the original question, some good ones: IMSleep series (Ro8, IM vs fOu) for some interesting Protoss BOs and unit combinations, IMMvp vs oGsMC just because of the players involved
Anyone else sad it wasn't an all-pro 4v4 tournament? Could've been epic.

Boxer's Ro8 match was interesting too, if only because he can see some crazy tank/dropship micro.  He lets the tank fire once, picks it up so marauders can't hit it, drops it to fire once, and picks it back up.  The tank fire rate is roughly equivalent to what it would be unmicrod, but it takes much less damage from ground-only units.  Pretty amazing
Hey I agree that 1v1 is the superior setting, but seeing pros go at it in an epic fashion is fun too...
Today's finals match has been pretty good.  In particular, look at the ST_Bomber vs IMLosira match.  Lots of tense moments due to mistakes made by making the units dance.
going back and forward dance or /dance dance
/dance dance.  There were lots of (hilarious) BM being thrown around
Uhhhhhhhhhh so yeah that was the best series I've ever seen.  The squirtle v. MVP game was... oh my god there are no words haha
